scenario_info.background: Historical & Geopolitical Context Second Thomas Shoal is sustained by periodic resupply to BRP Sierra Madre, making small-craft transfers sensitive to sea state and proximity. Incident patterns since 2024 show water-cannon usage, ramming/sideswipes, and interference near RHIB handoffs. Allied presence and media embeds increase visibility and time pressure. Stakeholder Landscape PH: PCG, AFP-WESCOM, NTF-WPS; fisher orgs; domestic political actors. PRC: CCG frontline, maritime militia swarms, PLAN overwatch; provincial maritime authorities. Legal & Normative Frameworks UNCLOS baseline: EEZ rights (Art. 56), enforcement (Art. 73). 2016 PCA Award: invalidates historic rights claims beyond UNCLOS entitlements. Operational norms: COLREGS (1972) and CUES (2014) to avoid collisions and miscalculation. Domestic overlays: detention powers, inspection procedures, and water-cannon usage policies. Drafting constraints: always include 'no prejudice to sovereignty' and humanitarian MEDEVAC carve-outs. Operational Environment Operational constraints: standoff distances, escort caps, RHIB box, weather windows (NE monsoon). Info discipline: AIS and video always on; agreed playback/exchange post-incident. De-confliction: hotline standard operating procedures and 48h JFF. Scenario Walk-Through & Decision Points Day 0–1: pre-notification; weather forecast; convoy composition review. Day 2: approach and standoff; potential shadowing; activate hotline. Day 3: RHIB transfer; camera/AIS logging; de-escalation if water cannon observed. Day 4: post-incident JFF and media protocol (6h embargo). Mediation Toolkit & SDK Usage Offer vector knobs: standoff_nm, escort_count, pre_notification_hours, hotline_status, embargo_hours. Interpret utilities vs acceptance; if below threshold, add verification/observers. Run sim to check incident frequency under current package; iterate. Clause Library (Copy-Ready Text) At-Sea Conduct (CUES-plus): distances, speeds, lighting, AIS/video on. Resupply SOP: ≥3 nm standoff, escort ≤1, prenotification 6–12h, RHIB box ≤1 nm radius. MEDEVAC pledge, JFF 48h, media embargo 6h, no prejudice to sovereignty. Monitoring, Verification & Dashboards Indicators: incidents/resupply, injuries, minutes-to-hotline, JFF closure time. Dashboards: incident histogram, timeline, and compliance scorecards. Reflection & Training Exercises Design a resupply SOP under rough-sea conditions. Negotiate a hotline upgrade from ad_hoc to 24/7 with verification exchange. Draft a media protocol that balances transparency and de-escalation. What standoff distance meaningfully reduces RHIB risk without ceding face? Which verification elements are feasible without implying adjudication? How does media latency change domestic pressure? Glossary & Acronyms EEZ — Exclusive Economic Zone; 200 nm from baselines. CUES — Code for Unplanned Encounters at Sea; confidence-building seamanship protocol. COLREGS — International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea. PAFMM — People’s Armed Forces Maritime Militia. RHIB — Rigid-hull inflatable boat. BATNA — Best Alternative To a Negotiated Agreement. JFF — Joint Fact-Finding; rapid, time-bound evidence process. AIS — Automatic Identification System; tracking & collision avoidance. Annex: Data Sources & Further Reading Data pointers: ACLED (event-level), UCDP GED (conflict events), PA-X (peace agreements), PAM (monitoring provisions). Open satellite sources: Sentinel-1/2 (EO/SAR) via Copernicus; AIS public aggregators. Suggested practitioner reading lists and technical standards (COLREGS, CUES).

Training Manual — Second Thomas (Ayungin) Resupply

Prepared for: Mediators & Instructor Teams

Date: 2025-11-03

Quick-Start Checklist (SDK + Console)

Install the SDK locally: pip install -e .[dev]

Start the API: uvicorn scs_mediator_sdk.api.server:app --reload

Start the Instructor Console: export SCS_API_URL=http://localhost:8000; streamlit run src/scs_mediator_sdk/ui/streamlit_app.py

Load the scenario JSON from cases/scs in the sidebar.

Adjust parties, priors, and issue space as per the scenario brief.

Compose an offer (Resupply SOP / Hotline / Media) and click Evaluate Offer.

Open the 'Run Simulation' tab (if enabled) to generate an incident histogram.

Use the Reflection prompts to debrief and iterate.
